titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Castle, Indictment
CWG6592

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Johnson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Jno Castle
The Grand Jury of Johnson County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John Castle. of the offence of Grand Larceny committed as follows, to wit

The said John Castle on the 1st day of January 1864 in the county an circuit aforesaid did willfully & feloniously take, steal & carry off a certain Blacksmiths Vice the personal property of Stephen Bryan & Henry Chandler of the value of more than four dollars Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
I Certify that the above is a true copy of the Indictment here on file in our county,

John Hawes
Clerk Johnson circuit court,

200
Johnson Cir Ct
The Commonwealth
vs. } Indictment for Gd. Larceny
Jno Castle
A True Bill
^sgd^ N. A. Brown Foreman
Comths Witnesse
Stephen Bryan
Henry Chandler
Filed June 1st 1865
Sgd J Hawes clk
refused
